bibl.title: New Evidence for the Dating of Cleitarchus (POxy LXXI. 4808)? Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: The recently published P. Oxy. LXXI, 4808 [= M.-P.3 2257.01; LDAB 112363], an evaluation of Alexander and Diadoch historians, says that Cleitarchus was the tutor of Ptolemy IV (Philopator), a notice that, if true, would significantly affect the 'high' dating of Cleitarchus by which he is assigned to the end of the 4th / beginning of the 3rd c. BC. Re-assesses the evidence for the high dating of Cleitarchus, concluding that it remains likeliest, and that the new papyrus' date is incorrect and ought not to affect the communis opinio.
bibl.seg: Prandi Luisa, New Evidence for the Dating of Cleitarchus (POxy LXXI. 4808)? Avec résumé en anglais.
Histos 6 (2012) pp. 15-26. [Accessible en ligne, en téléchargement gratuit: < http://research.ncl.ac.uk/histos/HISTOS62012.html >.]

The recently published P. Oxy. LXXI, 4808 [= M.-P.3 2257.01; LDAB 112363], an evaluation of Alexander and Diadoch historians, says that Cleitarchus was the tutor of Ptolemy IV (Philopator), a notice that, if true, would significantly affect the 'high' dating of Cleitarchus by which he is assigned to the end of the 4th / beginning of the 3rd c. BC. Re-assesses the evidence for the high dating of Cleitarchus, concluding that it remains likeliest, and that the new papyrus' date is incorrect and ought not to affect the communis opinio.
